text: Rand Donald Conger (born August 29, 1941) is Distinguished Professor Emeritus of Human Development & Family Studies at the University of California, Davis. He previously taught at Iowa State University, where he was the founding director of the Institute for Social and Behavioral Research. He is known for his research on risk factors for, and protective factors against, substance use and mental disorders. He has also researched the effects of stress on child development and academic achievement. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:American social psychologists Category:Developmental psychologists Category:People from Tacoma, Washington Category:University of California, Davis faculty Category:University of Washington alumni Category:Iowa State University faculty
title: Rand Conger
